column1: Male patient, 71 years old, travels to pulmonary stenosis for fever (37.8 Â°) and cough, eupnoic. In history of ischemic heart disease. Saturation pO2 97%. Chest x-ray is required performed with a portable device positioned in a tensile structure specifically used outside the pulmonary stenosis

The radiographic investigation shows a widespread increase in the peribroncovascular interstitial plot with associated multiple areas of parenchymal thickening arranged mainly at the level of the upper field of both lungs. Heart increased in volume; hypo-expanded but free of pouring costofrenic sinuses.
The patient is subjected to a nasopharyngeal swab (positive for COVID-19) and hospitalized for the necessary assistance and care.
The PZ after 3 days, with good and stable clinical conditions, performs control computed/computerized tomography

The computed/computerized tomography investigation shows the presence of multiple emery glass parenchymal thickenings, some confluent to each other, located in the upper lobe of both lungs and in the apical segment of the lower lobe of both lungs arranged mainly in the subpleural area.
